Posted By: ratchet1215 (8/27/2009 10:08:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Heh, Phil Foglio art is always worth a chuckle!
  
   
Not much to be said for this card - it's not efficient burn by red's standards, but green really doesn't get many direct damage effects like this, so I think it's costed well. Pretty much all of the spells in this vein have the same flavour - [Unyaro Bee Sting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unyaro Bee Sting) is functionally identical to this one, and was the first of its kind; since then, they have added [Unyaro Bees](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Unyaro Bees) as another Time Spiral "nod to the past", and very recently [Hornet Sting](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hornet Sting) has been added to the list.
  
   
A dedicated theme-deck builder probably has enough cards to make an actual theme deck for bees, wasps and hornets. How effective such a deck would be is... questionable... but it would be cool to see!
posts.html:

A dedicated theme-deck builder probably has enough cards to make an actual theme deck for bees, wasps and hornets. How effective such a deck would be is... questionable... but it would be cool to see!

posts.post_content:
try [moonglove extract](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=moonglove extract) for pseudo-instant speed damage at 1 less mana. Or [brittle effigy](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=brittle effigy) for straight up creature killing.  
  
Still, a very silly card. Perhaps the bee stinging flavor should return, but as a red/green hybrid?
